Isabella Rodriguez.description: closing Hobbs Cafe and getting ready for her birthday party at 7:30 pm @ the Ville:Isabella Rodriguez's apartment:main room:refrigerator

Carlos Gomez.description: reflecting on the conversation with Klaus Mueller and making plans for incorporating diverse Black voices and community involvement in the project. (conversing about Carlos Gomez and Tamara Taylor are discussing how to incorporate elements of jazz music, spoken word, traditional African music, hip-hop, nature, and involvement of local Black artists, storytellers, Black, Hispanic, and Asian communities, as well as addressing systemic inequalities exacerbated by gentrification in their project to capture the essence of the Black community and promote inclusivity, diversity, empowerment, and social justice, while also emphasizing the importance of involving Black youth and community organizations for a sustainable impact and legacy.) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room sofa

Klaus Mueller.description: participating in a group discussion @ the Ville:Dorm for Oak Hill College:common room:common room table

Sam Moore.description: enjoying his birthday party at The Rose and Crown Pub with friends and loved ones (sharing stories from his time in the military) @ the Ville:Moore family's house:main room:common room sofa

Ayesha Khan.description: getting ready to meet Wolfgang for coffee (doing her makeup) @ the Ville:Dorm for Oak Hill College:woman's bathroom:bathroom sink

Wolfgang Schulz.description: reviewing notes before meeting Ayesha for coffee (conversing about Klaus Mueller and Wolfgang Schulz are discussing ways to involve the local Black community in their project through collaboration with Black artists and organizations, organizing a community event to showcase their talents and perspectives, and ensuring their voices are heard and respected.) @ the Ville:Oak Hill College:library:library table

Eddy Lin.description: finalizing and saving his progress on the composition project before taking a break. (conversing about incorporating elements of traditional African music and storytelling, reaching out to local Black artists, involving members of the Black community directly, educating themselves on the struggles and history of the Black community, creating a safe and inclusive space for the Black community, collaborating with local community organizations, incorporating elements of hip-hop culture and spoken word performances, delving into Black history and African folklore, highlighting the resilience and strength of the Black community, seeking feedback and listening to the voices of the Black community, empowering Black voices, addressing systemic inequalities, and collaborating with community organizations that support Black youth.) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room sofa

Tom Moreno.description: spending quality time with his wife after dinner (catching up with his wife about their day) @ the Ville:Moreno family's house:Tom and Jane Moreno's bedroom:bed

Tamara Taylor.description: finalizing ideas and setting a plan for their project (conversing about Carlos Gomez and Tamara Taylor are discussing how to incorporate elements of jazz music, spoken word, traditional African music, hip-hop, nature, and involvement of local Black artists, storytellers, Black, Hispanic, and Asian communities, as well as addressing systemic inequalities exacerbated by gentrification in their project to capture the essence of the Black community and promote inclusivity, diversity, empowerment, and social justice, while also emphasizing the importance of involving Black youth and community organizations for a sustainable impact and legacy.) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room sofa

Adam Smith.description: setting up a meeting with Tamara at the local coffee shop next week to discuss her children's book series and the importance of diversity and representation in storytelling (conversing about incorporating elements of traditional African music and storytelling, reaching out to local Black artists, involving members of the Black community directly, educating themselves on the struggles and history of the Black community, creating a safe and inclusive space for the Black community, collaborating with local community organizations, incorporating elements of hip-hop culture and spoken word performances, delving into Black history and African folklore, highlighting the resilience and strength of the Black community, seeking feedback and listening to the voices of the Black community, empowering Black voices, addressing systemic inequalities, and collaborating with community organizations that support Black youth.) @ the Ville:Hobbs Cafe:cafe:cafe customer seating
